parameter.name: encoding
parameter.description: The default encoding of the Message body to be used if the message doesn't communicate it

parameter.name: contentType
parameter.description: The default contentType of the Message body to be used if the message doesn't communicate it

parameter.name: sendCorrelationId
parameter.description: Whether to specify a correlationId when publishing messages. This applies both for custom correlation ids specifies at the operation level and for default correlation Ids taken from the current event

parameter.name: expirationPolicy
parameter.description: Configures the minimum amount of time that a dynamic configuration instance can remain idle before the runtime considers it eligible for expiration. This does not mean that the platform will expire the instance at the exact moment that it becomes eligible. The runtime will actually purge the instances when it sees it fit.

parameter.name: ackMode
parameter.description: The ConsumerAckMode to use when consuming a Message Can be overridden at the message source level. This attribute has to be IMMEDIATE if transactionType is LOCAL or MULTI

parameter.name: consumerType
parameter.description: The ConsumerType to be used by default when consuming a Message Can be overridden at the message source level.

parameter.name: selector
parameter.description: Default selector to be used for filtering when consuming a Message Can be overridden at the message source level.

parameter.name: maxRedelivery
parameter.description: Used to configure the number of redelivers before discarding the message. No redelivery is represented with 0, while -1 means infinite re deliveries accepted.

parameter.name: persistentDelivery
parameter.description: Sets the default value for the Message#getJMSDeliveryMode. If true, the DeliveryMode#PERSISTENT mode will be used, which instructs the JMS provider to take extra care to insure the message is not lost in transit due to a JMS provider failure.

parameter.name: priority
parameter.description: Defines the default Message#getJMSPriority to use when sending messages

parameter.name: timeToLive
parameter.description: Defines the default time the message will be in the broker before it expires and is discarded

parameter.name: timeToLiveUnit
parameter.description:
A TimeUnit which qualifies the #timeToLive attribute.

Defaults to MILLISECONDS

parameter.name: disableMessageId
parameter.description: Defines the default value to use when producing messages, for disabling the Message#getJMSMessageID generation in the broker. Depending on the provider it may or may not have effect

parameter.name: disableMessageTimestamp
parameter.description: Defines the default value to use, when producing messages, for disable Message#getJMSTimestamp generation in the broker. Depending on the provider it may or may not have effect.

parameter.name: deliveryDelay
parameter.description:
This is used to determine the Message delivery delay time which is calculated by adding the deliveryDelay value specified on the send method to the time the message was sent.

Only used in JmsSpecification#JMS_2_0

parameter.name: deliveryDelayUnit
parameter.description:
A TimeUnit which qualifies the #deliveryDelay attribute.

Defaults to MILLISECONDS

parameter.name: jmsType
parameter.description: A message JMSType identifier supplied by a client when a message is sent.

connection.name: active-mq
connection.description: A ConnectionProvider that contains custom logic to handle ActiveMQ connections in particular

parameter.name: specification
parameter.description: Versions of the JmsSpecification to be used by the extension. This version should be compatible with the implementation of the ConnectionFactory configured. Functionality available only for certain versions of the spec will throw an error if the version requirement is not met.

parameter.name: cachingStrategy
parameter.description: the strategy to be used for caching of Sessions and Connections

parameter.name: tlsConfiguration
parameter.description: TLS/SSL Configuration to be able to create Secure and Encrypted ActiveMQ Connections

parameter.name: username
parameter.description: Username to be used when providing credentials for authentication.

parameter.name: password
parameter.description: Password to be used when providing credentials for authentication.

parameter.name: clientId
parameter.description:
Client identifier to be assigned to the Connection upon creation. The purpose of client identifier is to associate a connection and its objects with a state maintained on behalf of the client by a provider. By definition, the client state identified by a client identifier can be "in use" by only one client at a time.

The only use of a client identifier defined by JMS is its mandatory use in identifying an unshared durable subscription or its optional use in identifying a shared durable or non-durable subscription.

parameter.name: reconnection
parameter.description: When the application is deployed, a connectivity test is performed on all connectors. If set to true, deployment will fail if the test doesn't pass after exhausting the associated reconnection strategy

parameter.name: minPoolSize
parameter.description: The minimum size of the XA connection pool. This value is only considered when XA connections are used.

parameter.name: maxPoolSize
parameter.description: The maximum size of the XA connection pool. This value is only considered when XA connections are used.

parameter.name: maxIdleSeconds
parameter.description: How many seconds can an XA transaction remain idle before its eligible for eviction. This value is only considered when XA connections are used.

parameter.name: factoryConfiguration
parameter.description: Parameters required to configure a default ActiveMQConnectionFactory

parameter.name: connectionFactory
parameter.description: A custom ConnectionFactory that relates to an ActiveMQConnectionFactory

connection.name: generic
connection.description: Generic implementation of a JMS ConnectionProvider. This provider uses any ConnectionFactory that the user configures in order to create a JmsConnection.

parameter.name: specification
parameter.description: Versions of the JmsSpecification to be used by the extension. This version should be compatible with the implementation of the ConnectionFactory configured. Functionality available only for certain versions of the spec will throw an error if the version requirement is not met.

parameter.name: cachingStrategy
parameter.description: the strategy to be used for caching of Sessions and Connections

parameter.name: connectionFactory
parameter.description: a JMS ConnectionFactory implementation

parameter.name: username
parameter.description: Username to be used when providing credentials for authentication.

parameter.name: password
parameter.description: Password to be used when providing credentials for authentication.

parameter.name: clientId
parameter.description:
Client identifier to be assigned to the Connection upon creation. The purpose of client identifier is to associate a connection and its objects with a state maintained on behalf of the client by a provider. By definition, the client state identified by a client identifier can be "in use" by only one client at a time.

The only use of a client identifier defined by JMS is its mandatory use in identifying an unshared durable subscription or its optional use in identifying a shared durable or non-durable subscription.

parameter.name: reconnection
parameter.description: When the application is deployed, a connectivity test is performed on all connectors. If set to true, deployment will fail if the test doesn't pass after exhausting the associated reconnection strategy

parameter.name: minPoolSize
parameter.description: The minimum size of the XA connection pool. This value is only considered when XA connections are used.

parameter.name: maxPoolSize
parameter.description: The maximum size of the XA connection pool. This value is only considered when XA connections are used.

parameter.name: maxIdleSeconds
parameter.description: How many seconds can an XA transaction remain idle before its eligible for eviction. This value is only considered when XA connections are used.

extension.name: JMS
extension.description: JmsConnector is a JMS 1.0.2b, 1.1 and 2.0 compliant MuleSoft Extension, used to consume and produce JMS Messages. The Extension supports all JMS functionality including topics and queues, durable subscribers, acknowledgement modes and local transactions.

operation.name: consume
operation.description: Operation that allows the user to consume a single Message from a given Destination.

parameter.name: destination
parameter.description: the name of the Destination from where the Message should be consumed

parameter.name: consumerType
parameter.description: the type of the MessageConsumer that is required for the given destination, along with any extra configurations that are required based on the destination type.

parameter.name: ackMode
parameter.description: the ConsumerAckMode that will be configured over the Message and Session

parameter.name: selector
parameter.description: a custom JMS selector for filtering the messages

parameter.name: contentType
parameter.description: the Message's content content type

parameter.name: encoding
parameter.description: the Message's content encoding

parameter.name: maximumWait
parameter.description: maximum time to wait for a message before timing out

parameter.name: maximumWaitUnit
parameter.description: Time unit to be used in the maximumWaitTime configurations

parameter.name: transactionalAction
parameter.description: The type of joining action that operations can take regarding transactions.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: publish
operation.description: Operation that allows the user to send a Message to a JMS Destination

parameter.name: destination
parameter.description: the name of the Destination where the Message should be sent

parameter.name: destinationType
parameter.description: the DestinationType of the destination

parameter.name: transactionalAction
parameter.description: Transactional Action for the operation. Indicates if the publish must be executed or not in a transaction.

parameter.name: sendCorrelationId
parameter.description: options on whether to include an outbound correlation id or not

parameter.name: body
parameter.description: The body of the Message

parameter.name: jmsType
parameter.description: The JMSType header of the Message

parameter.name: correlationId
parameter.description: The JMSCorrelationID header of the Message

parameter.name: sendContentType
parameter.description: true if the body type should be sent as a Message property

parameter.name: outboundContentType
parameter.description: The content type of the body

parameter.name: sendEncoding
parameter.description: true if the body outboundEncoding should be sent as a Message property

parameter.name: outboundEncoding
parameter.description: The outboundEncoding of the message's body

parameter.name: replyTo
parameter.description: The JMSReplyTo header information of the Destination where this Message should be replied to

parameter.name: properties
parameter.description: The custom user properties that should be set to this Message

parameter.name: jmsxProperties
parameter.description: The JMSX properties that should be set to this Message

parameter.name: persistentDelivery
parameter.description: If true; the Message will be sent using the PERSISTENT JMSDeliveryMode

parameter.name: priority
parameter.description: The default JMSPriority value to be used when sending the message

parameter.name: timeToLive
parameter.description: Defines the default time the message will be in the broker before it expires and is discarded

parameter.name: timeToLiveUnit
parameter.description: Time unit to be used in the timeToLive configurations

parameter.name: disableMessageId
parameter.description: If true; the Message will be flagged to avoid generating its MessageID

parameter.name: disableMessageTimestamp
parameter.description: If true; the Message will be flagged to avoid generating its sent Timestamp

parameter.name: deliveryDelay
parameter.description: Only used by JMS 2.0. Sets the delivery delay to be applied in order to postpone the Message delivery

parameter.name: deliveryDelayUnit
parameter.description: Time unit to be used in the deliveryDelay configurations

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: publishConsume
operation.description: Operation that allows the user to send a message to a JMS Destination and waits for a response either to the provided ReplyTo destination or to a temporary Destination created dynamically

parameter.name: destination
parameter.description: the name of the Destination where the Message should be sent

parameter.name: sendCorrelationId
parameter.description: options on whether to include an outbound correlation id or not

parameter.name: body
parameter.description: The body of the Message

parameter.name: jmsType
parameter.description: The JMSType header of the Message

parameter.name: correlationId
parameter.description: The JMSCorrelationID header of the Message

parameter.name: sendContentType
parameter.description: true if the body type should be sent as a Message property

parameter.name: outboundContentType
parameter.description: The content type of the body

parameter.name: sendEncoding
parameter.description: true if the body outboundEncoding should be sent as a Message property

parameter.name: outboundEncoding
parameter.description: The outboundEncoding of the message's body

parameter.name: replyTo
parameter.description: The JMSReplyTo header information of the Destination where this Message should be replied to

parameter.name: properties
parameter.description: The custom user properties that should be set to this Message

parameter.name: jmsxProperties
parameter.description: The JMSX properties that should be set to this Message

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: ack
operation.description: Allows the user to perform an ACK when the AckMode#MANUAL mode is elected while consuming the Message. As per JMS Spec, performing an ACK over a single Message automatically works as an ACK for all the Messages produced in the same JmsSession.

parameter.name: ackId
parameter.description: The AckId of the Message to ACK

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

operation.name: recoverSession
operation.description: Allows the user to perform a session recover when the AckMode#MANUAL mode is elected while consuming the Message. As per JMS Spec, performing a session recover automatically will redeliver all the consumed messages that had not being acknowledged before this recover.

parameter.name: ackId
parameter.description: The AckId of the Message Session to recover

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

source.name: listener
source.description: JMS Subscriber for Destinations, allows to listen for incoming Messages

parameter.name: destination
parameter.description: The name of the Destination from where the Message should be consumed

parameter.name: consumerType
parameter.description: The Type of the Consumer that should be used for the provided destination

parameter.name: ackMode
parameter.description: The Session ACK mode to use when consuming a message

parameter.name: selector
parameter.description: JMS selector to be used for filtering incoming messages

parameter.name: inboundContentType
parameter.description: The content type of the message body

parameter.name: inboundEncoding
parameter.description: The inboundEncoding of the message body

parameter.name: numberOfConsumers
parameter.description: The number of concurrent consumers that will be used to receive JMS Messages

parameter.name: transactionalAction
parameter.description: The type of beginning action that sources can take regarding transactions.

parameter.name: transactionType
parameter.description: The type of transaction to create. Availability will depend on the runtime version.

parameter.name: primaryNodeOnly
parameter.description: Whether this source should only be executed on the primary node when runnning in Cluster

parameter.name: redeliveryPolicy
parameter.description: Defines a policy for processing the redelivery of the same message

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

parameter.name: body
parameter.description: The body of the Message

parameter.name: jmsType
parameter.description: The JMSType header of the Message

parameter.name: correlationId
parameter.description: The JMSCorrelationID header of the Message

parameter.name: sendContentType
parameter.description: true if the body type should be sent as a Message property

parameter.name: outboundContentType
parameter.description: The content type of the body

parameter.name: sendEncoding
parameter.description: true if the body outboundEncoding should be sent as a Message property

parameter.name: outboundEncoding
parameter.description: The outboundEncoding of the message's body

parameter.name: replyTo
parameter.description: The JMSReplyTo header information of the Destination where this Message should be replied to

parameter.name: properties
parameter.description: The custom user properties that should be set to this Message

parameter.name: jmsxProperties
parameter.description: The JMSX properties that should be set to this Message

parameter.name: persistentDelivery
parameter.description: Whether or not the delivery should be done with a persistent configuration

parameter.name: priority
parameter.description: The default JMSPriority value to be used when sending the message

parameter.name: timeToLive
parameter.description: Defines the default time the message will be in the broker before it expires and is discarded

parameter.name: timeToLiveUnit
parameter.description: Time unit to be used in the timeToLive configurations

parameter.name: disableMessageId
parameter.description: If true; the Message will be flagged to avoid generating its MessageID

parameter.name: disableMessageTimestamp
parameter.description: If true; the Message will be flagged to avoid generating its sent Timestamp

parameter.name: deliveryDelay
parameter.description: Only used by JMS 2.0. Sets the delivery delay to be applied in order to postpone the Message delivery

parameter.name: deliveryDelayUnit
parameter.description: Time unit to be used in the deliveryDelay configurations

parameter.name: sendCorrelationId
parameter.description: Options on whether to include an outbound correlation id or not

parameter.name: requestReplyPattern
parameter.description: Indicates which Request Reply Pattern to use. By default uses the Correlation ID of the incoming message to do the Reply-To. In case of configuring the Message ID pattern, the ReplyTo will be performed using the message ID of the incoming message. If NONE is selected, not correlation ID will be configured automatically.

type.name: org.mule.extensions.jms.api.connection.caching.CachingStrategy
type.description:
Defines the strategy to be used for caching of Connections
@since 1.0

type.name: org.mule.extensions.jms.api.connection.caching.DefaultCachingStrategy
org.mule.extensions.jms.api.connection.caching.NoCachingConfiguration
type.description:
Implementation of CachingConfiguration is the recommended only if an external CachingConnectionFactory is already being parameterized or if this extension is being used in the context of a Java EE web or EJB application.
@since 4,0

type.name: org.mule.extensions.jms.api.connection.factory.activemq.ActiveMQConnectionFactoryConfiguration
type.description:
Contains the parameters required to configure an ActiveMQConnectionFactory
@since 1.0

parameter.name: brokerUrl
parameter.description: The address of the broker to connect

parameter.name: enable-xa
parameter.description: ConnectionFactory should support XA

parameter.name: initialRedeliveryDelay
parameter.description: Used to configure the RedeliveryPolicy#getInitialRedeliveryDelay()

parameter.name: redeliveryDelay
parameter.description: Used to configure the RedeliveryPolicy#getRedeliveryDelay()

parameter.name: maxRedelivery
parameter.description: Used to configure the RedeliveryPolicy#getMaximumRedeliveries() No redelivery is represented with 0, while -1 means infinite re deliveries accepted.

parameter.name: trustedPackages
parameter.description: Whitelist of packages of classes that are allowed sent and received. This property starting versions 5.12.2 and 5.13.0, ActiveMQ enforces users to explicitly whitelist packages that can be exchanged using ObjectMessages.

parameter.name: trustAllPackages
parameter.description: Indicates if any class from any package can be sent and received. Enabling this is unsafe as malicious payload can exploit the host system. This property starting versions 5.12.2 and 5.13.0, ActiveMQ enforces users to explicitly whitelist packages that can be exchanged using ObjectMessages.

type.name: org.mule.extensions.jms.api.connection.factory.jndi.CachedJndiNameResolver
type.description:
Defines a JndiNameResolver that uses a cache in order to store the already resolved names. <p/> The cache does not have an automated mechanism for cleaning up the data. In case of getting corrupt data, a way to cleaning up the cache is to stop and then restart the instance.
@since 1.0

type.name: org.mule.extensions.jms.api.connection.factory.jndi.JndiConnectionFactory

parameter.name: connectionFactoryJndiName
parameter.description: Name of the ConnectionFactory to be discovered using Jndi and used as a delegate of ConnectionFactory

parameter.name: lookupDestination
parameter.description: The Destinations

parameter.name: nameResolverProvider
parameter.description: Provider for the JndiNameResolver

type.name: org.mule.extensions.jms.api.connection.factory.jndi.JndiNameResolver
type.description:
Defines a strategy for lookup objects by name using JNDI.
@since 1.0

type.name: org.mule.extensions.jms.api.connection.factory.jndi.SimpleJndiNameResolver
type.description:
Defines a simple Context instance opened all the time and always relies on the context to do the look ups.
@since 1.0

type.name: org.mule.extensions.jms.api.destination.ConsumerType
org.mule.extensions.jms.api.destination.JmsDestination

parameter.name: destination
parameter.description: The name that identifies the destination where a reply to a message should be sent

parameter.name: destinationType
parameter.description: the type of this destination

type.name: org.mule.extensions.jms.api.destination.QueueConsumer
org.mule.extensions.jms.api.destination.TopicConsumer
org.mule.extensions.jms.api.message.JmsAttributes
type.description:
Contains all the metadata of a JMS Message, it carries information such as the Headers, the Properties and the required ID for performing an ACK on the Message.

@since 1.0

parameter.name: properties
parameter.description: Container element for all the properties present in a JMS Message

parameter.name: headers
parameter.description: All the possible headers of a JMS Message

parameter.name: ackId
parameter.description: The session ACK ID required to ACK a the current Message if one is available, or null otherwise.

type.name: org.mule.extensions.jms.api.message.JmsxProperties
